alert.note: Alert for Ouachita; Union (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 8:16AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Union and Ouachita Parishes through 900 AM CDT... At 816 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles south of Farmerville to 11 miles southwest of Brownsville-Bawcom. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Monroe, Claiborne, West Monroe, Swartz, Brownsville-Bawcom, Brownsville-Bawcomville, Richwood, Sterlington, Downsville, Drew, Fondale, Bosco, Millhaven, Folksville, Rocky Branch, Mineral Springs, Guthrie, Deshard, Fairbanks and Perryville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
